page.title: 09 A HISTORY OF CAERSWS
page.content: THE FIRST SETTLEMENT IN CAERSWS REACHES BACK INTO PREHISTORIC TIMES.THERE IS EVIDENCE OF FORTIFIED ENCAMPMENTS THAT WERE BUILT IN THE EARLY IRON AGE.THE SITES WERE ON CEFN CARNEDD,LLANWNOG AND IN THE FEN BELOW GWYNFYNEDD.CEFN CARNEDD WAS OCCUPIED AFTER THE CONCLUSION OF THE ROMAN OCCUPATION.IT WAS DEFENDED BY RAMPARTS AND DITCHES.THE INHABITANTS KEPT DOMESTIC ANIMALS INCLUDING CATTLE AND SHEEP.AGRICULTURE WAS PRACTISED.THE FARMERS OF THE ENCAMPMENT WERE CONQUERED BY THE ROMANS WHO BUILT A CAMP, IN THE SHAPE OF A SQUARE, IN PENDREF.THIS CAMP CONTAINED A VILLA - DIGGING HAS REVEALED SAMIAN WARE AND PARTS OF AMPHORAE.ROADS RADIATED FROM THE CAMP IN ALL DIRECTIONS TO N.WALES,S.WALES AND WESTWARD TO THE SOURCES OF LEAD.
